originalText.text:
OK if you're looking for years-long therapy...but...not ideal if you're looking to get healthier and more independent. Shares far too much about other clients (details even!), which means she's probably sharing information about you (IDK but seems likely), texts you incessantly which I found odd at first, then invasive later, urged me to come in or have phone sessions 2-3 times weekly (which looking back seems unnecessary and invites dependence).

Kind though and has good ideas but ultimately when/if you share anything that is on your mind bothering you about your sessions with her, she suddenly becomes evasive, defensive, and criticizes you for being "outlandishly angry" when you were actually timid, empathetic (with her!), and rational.  I realized far too late that I needed less of a dependence therapy model and more of an empowering one.

Also, and one MAJOR sticking point and problem is that she pushes you to confront trauma, then when you inevitably reach a breaking point, she has no idea how to put Humpty Dumpty back together again...and sends you elsewhere. Then she pushes you to revisit the trauma over and over again with no plan or exercises to help you recuperate from serious PTSD. Ultimately...dangerous.  Currently, getting therapy for the therapy I had with her. Buyer beware. (1 more weird, unsettling thing...texts constantly during sessions. Unreal.)

originalText.text: Paula Sobel is an excellent therapist; she is very knowledgeable; great experience, helpful, kind and caring.

text.text: Paula Sobel is an excellent therapist; she is very knowledgeable; great experience, helpful, kind and caring.
